employees:reasons_of_leaving:film_shutdo: Early termination of the employment contract due to filming halt

employees:reasons_of_leaving:gross_misco: Early termination of employment contract for gross misconduct
employees:reasons_of_leaving:liquidation: Dismissal following liquidation or judicial reorganization
employees:reasons_of_leaving:mobility_le: Amicable termination as part of a mobility leave
employees:reasons_of_leaving:mutual_agre: Mutual agreement termination for entry into PAP
employees:reasons_of_leaving:mutual_fixe: Mutual termination of the fixed-term contract or apprenticeship contract
employees:reasons_of_leaving:other_econo: Other termination of contract for economic reasons
employees:reasons_of_leaving:parliamenta: Dismissal of parliamentary collaborator (Art. 18 and 19 of law no. 2017-1339 of September 15, 2017)
employees:reasons_of_leaving:project_com: Dismissal due to completion of project or mission
employees:reasons_of_leaving:resignation: Resignation following the sale or cessation of the newspaper or periodical, or conscience clause
employees:reasons_of_leaving:serious_mis: Early termination of the employment contract for serious misconduct
employees:reasons_of_leaving:specific_re: Dismissal for specific reason (Art. L.2254-2 Labor Code)
employees:reasons_of_leaving:transfer_wi: Transfer of the employment contract without termination of the contract to another establishment not registered in the DSN
employees:reasons_of_leaving:unfitness_n: Dismissal due to non-work-related physical disability
employees:reasons_of_leaving:unfitness_o: Dismissal due to work-related physical disability

Would you like to disable overtime compensation for %{name}?

The hour tracker in the employees tab is useful if you use a system of annualized hours at your establishment. It summarizes all the hours assigned to your employee on the schedule and the hours they have accumulated, over or under their contracted hours, up to a specific moment in time.

For example, if Paul’s contract specifies that he works 35 hours per week (weekly contracted hours,) and he works 40 hours in week 1 (= +5 hours) and 33 hours in week 2 (= -2 hours,) his tracker will show +3H in week 2.
For more details on how the hour tracker is calculated, please refer to
How the hour tracker is calculated
employees:tabs:counters:hours_counter:he: Initialize the hour tracker and let Skello calculate it for you!
employees:tabs:counters:hours_counter:in: Changing the initialization date will delete all manually modified data from your employee's counter.
Are you sure you want to change the initialization date?
employees:tabs:counters:hours_counter:ma: The hour tracker in the employees tab is useful if you use a system of annualized hours at your establishment. It summarizes all the hours assigned to your employee on the schedule and the hours they have accumulated, over or under their contracted hours, up to a specific moment in time.

For example, in the hotel/cafe/restaurant sector, if Paul’s contract specifies that he works 35 hours per week (weekly contracted hours,) and he works 40 hours in week 1 (= +4 hours at 10% and 1 hour at 20% = +5h36m) then 33 hours in week 2 (= -2 hours,) his tracker will show +3h36m in week 2.
For more details on how the hour tracker is calculated, please refer to

Number of days to Add to/Remove from the PTO tracker
Manual adjustments to the PTO tracker

For the calculation of PTO, the reference period is from January 1st to December 31st of year N. At the end of this period, contact your accountant to reevaluate the PTO trackers for your employees.
You can modify the PTO tracker for any month in year N. To make manual adjustments, click on the "Manual adjustments" box for the relevant month and enter the adjustment you want to make to the tracker.

For the calculation of PTO, the reference period is from June 1st of year N-1 to May 31st of year N. At the end of this period, contact your accountant to reevaluate the PTO trackers for your employees.
You can modify the PTO tracker for any month in years N or N-1. To make manual adjustments, click on the "Manual adjustments" box for the relevant month and enter the adjustment you want to make to the tracker.
Initialize the PTO tracker and let Skello calculate it for you!

To help you get the most out of Skello, we have completely redesigned the PTO tracker! It is now calculated continuously from year to year, rather than being automatically reset to 0 each year. As part of the transition between the two systems, you will find your history for 2018 in the month of June 2018, in order to maintain the reset to zero for this year.
